CancelTask.document: This API is used to cancel a task.
CancelTask.name: Cancels a task

CreateSparkApp.document: This API is used to create a Spark application.
CreateSparkApp.name: Creates a Spark application

CreateSparkAppTask.document: This API is used to create a Spark task.
CreateSparkAppTask.name: Creates a Spark task

CreateTask.document: This API is used to create a SQL query task. (We recommend you use the `CreateTasks` API instead.)
CreateTask.name: Creates a task

CreateTasks.document: This API is used to create tasks in batches.
CreateTasks.name: Creates tasks in batches

DeleteSparkApp.document: This API is used to delete a Spark application.
DeleteSparkApp.name: Deletes a Spark application

DescribeSparkAppJob.document: This API is used to query a specific Spark application.
DescribeSparkAppJob.name: Queries a specific Spark application

DescribeSparkAppJobs.document: This API is used to get the list of Spark applications.
DescribeSparkAppJobs.name: Gets the list of Spark applications

DescribeSparkAppTasks.document: This API is used to query the list of running task instances of a Spark application.
DescribeSparkAppTasks.name: Queries the list of running task instances of a Spark application

DescribeTaskResult.document: This API is used to query the result of a task.
DescribeTaskResult.name: Queries the result of a task

DescribeTasks.document: This API is used to query the list of tasks.
DescribeTasks.name: Queries the list of tasks

ModifySparkApp.document: This API is used to update a Spark application.
ModifySparkApp.name: Updates a Spark application

SuspendResumeDataEngine.document: This API is used to suspend or resume a data engine.
SuspendResumeDataEngine.name: Suspends or resumes a data engine

members.document: Globally unique task ID

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

Column.document: Column information of the data table.

members.document: Column name, which is case-insensitive and can contain up to 25 characters.
members.name: Name

members.document:
Column type. Valid values:
string|tinyint|smallint|int|bigint|boolean|float|double|decimal|timestamp|date|binary|array<data_type>|map<primitive_type, data_type>|struct<col_name : data_type [COMMENT col_comment], ...>|uniontype<data_type, data_type, ...>.
members.name: Type

members.document:
Class comment.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Comment

members.document:
Length of the entire numeric value
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Precision

members.document:
Length of the decimal part
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Scale

members.document:
Whether the column is null.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Nullable

members.document:
Field position
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Position

members.document:
Field creation time
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: CreateTime

members.document:
Field modification time
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ModifiedTime

members.document:
Whether the column is the partition field.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: IsPartition

members.document: Computing task. This parameter contains the task type and related configuration information.

members.document: Database name. If there is a database name in the SQL statement, the database in the SQL statement will be used first; otherwise, the database specified by this parameter will be used (note: when submitting the database creation SQL statement, passed in an empty string for this field).

members.document: Unique task ID
members.name: TaskId

members.document: The pagination information returned by the last response. This parameter can be omitted for the first response, where the data will be returned from the beginning. The data with a volume set by the `MaxResults` field is returned each time.
members.name: NextToken

members.document: Maximum number of returned rows. Value range: 0–1,000. Default value: 1,000.
members.name: MaxResults

members.document:
The queried task information. If the returned value is empty, the task with the entered task ID does not exist. The task result will be returned only if the task status is `2` (succeeded).
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TaskInfo

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Number of returned results. Default value: 10. Maximum value: 100.
members.name: Limit

members.document: Offset. Default value: 0.
members.name: Offset

members.document:
Filter. The following filters are supported, and the `Name` input parameter must be one of them. Up to 50 `task-id` values can be filtered, while up to 5 other parameters can be filtered in total.
task-id - String - (filter by task ID). `task-id` format: e386471f-139a-4e59-877f-50ece8135b99.
task-state - String - (filter exactly by task status). Valid values: `0` (initial), `1` (running), `2` (succeeded), `-1` (failed).
task-sql-keyword - String - (filter fuzzily by SQL statement keyword, such as `DROP TABLE`).
task-operator- string (filter by sub-UIN)
task-kind - string (filter by task type)
members.name: Filters

members.document: Sorting field. Valid values: `create-time` (default value), `update-time`.
members.name: SortBy

members.document: Sorting order. Valid values: `asc` (ascending order), `desc` (descending order). Default value: `asc`.
members.name: Sorting

members.document: Start time in the format of `yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS`, which is the current time seven days ago by default.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: End time in the format of `yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS`, which is the current time by default. The time span is (0, 30] days. Data in the last 45 days can be queried.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Filter by compute resource name

members.document: The currently executed SQL statement. Each task contains one SQL statement.
members.name: SQL

members.document: Type of the executed task. Valid values: `DDL`, `DML`, `DQL`.
members.name: SQLType

members.document: Current status of the task. `0`: initial; `1`: task running; `2`: task execution succeeded; `-1`: task execution failed; `-3`: task terminated manually by the user. The task execution result will be returned only if task execution succeeds.
members.name: State

members.document: Amount of the data scanned in bytes
members.name: DataAmount

members.document: The compute time in ms.
members.name: UsedTime

members.document: Address of the COS bucket for storing the task result
members.name: OutputPath

members.document: Task creation timestamp
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Task execution information. `success` will be returned if the task succeeds; otherwise, the failure cause will be returned.
members.name: OutputMessage

members.document: Number of affected rows
members.name: RowAffectInfo

members.document:
Schema information of the result
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResultSchema

members.document:
Result information. After it is unescaped, each element of the outer array is a data row.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResultSet

members.document: Pagination information. If there is no more result data, `nextToken` will be empty.
members.name: NextToken

members.document: Task progress (%)
members.name: Percentage

members.document: Task progress details
members.name: ProgressDetail

members.document: Console display format. Valid values: `table`, `text`.
members.name: DisplayFormat

members.document: The task time in ms.
members.name: TotalTime

TasksInfo.document: Collection of tasks executed sequentially in batches

members.document: Task type. Valid values: `SQLTask` (SQL query task), `SparkSQLTask` (Spark SQL query task).
members.name: TaskType

members.document: Fault tolerance policy. `Proceed`: continues to execute subsequent tasks after the current task fails or is canceled. `Terminate`: terminates the execution of subsequent tasks after the current task fails or is canceled, and marks all subsequent tasks as canceled.
members.name: FailureTolerance

members.document: Base64-encrypted SQL statements separated by ";". Up to 50 tasks can be submitted at a time, and they will be executed strictly in sequence.
members.name: SQL

members.document: Configuration information of the task. Currently, only `SparkSQLTask` tasks are supported.
members.name: Config

members.document: User-defined parameters of the task
members.name: Params

members.document: The number of tasks in queue.
members.name: TaskQueuedCount

members.document: The number of initialized tasks.
members.name: TaskInitCount

members.document: The number of tasks in progress.
members.name: TaskRunningCount

members.document: The total number of tasks in this time range.
members.name: TotalTaskCount
